class.name: Dictionary
class.brief_description: A built-in data structure that holds key-value pairs.

constructor.name: Dictionary
constructor.description: Creates a typed dictionary from the [param base] dictionary. A typed dictionary can only contain keys and values of the given types, or that inherit from the given classes, as described by this constructor's parameters.

constructor.name: Dictionary
constructor.description: Returns the same dictionary as [param from]. If you need a copy of the dictionary, use [method duplicate].

method.name: assign
method.description: Assigns elements of another [param dictionary] into the dictionary. Resizes the dictionary to match [param dictionary]. Performs type conversions if the dictionary is typed.

method.name: clear
method.description: Clears the dictionary, removing all entries from it.

method.name: duplicate
method.description: Returns a new copy of the dictionary. By default, a [b]shallow[/b] copy is returned: all nested [Array], [Dictionary], and [Resource] keys and values are shared with the original dictionary. Modifying any of those in one dictionary will also affect them in the other. If [param deep] is [code]true[/code], a [b]deep[/b] copy is returned: all nested arrays and dictionaries are also duplicated (recursively). Any [Resource] is still shared with the original dictionary, though.

method.name: duplicate_deep
method.description: Duplicates this dictionary, deeply, like [method duplicate] when passing [code]true[/code], with extra control over how subresources are handled. [param deep_subresources_mode] must be one of the values from [enum Resource.DeepDuplicateMode]. By default, only internal resources will be duplicated (recursively).

method.name: erase
method.description: Removes the dictionary entry by key, if it exists. Returns [code]true[/code] if the given [param key] existed in the dictionary, otherwise [code]false[/code]. [b]Note:[/b] Do not erase entries while iterating over the dictionary. You can iterate over the [method keys] array instead.

method.name: find_key
method.description: Finds and returns the first key whose associated value is equal to [param value], or [code]null[/code] if it is not found. [b]Note:[/b] [code]null[/code] is also a valid key. If inside the dictionary, [method find_key] may give misleading results.

method.name: get
method.description: Returns the corresponding value for the given [param key] in the dictionary. If the [param key] does not exist, returns [param default], or [code]null[/code] if the parameter is omitted.

method.name: get_or_add
method.description: Gets a value and ensures the key is set. If the [param key] exists in the dictionary, this behaves like [method get]. Otherwise, the [param default] value is inserted into the dictionary and returned.

method.name: get_typed_key_builtin
method.description: Returns the built-in [Variant] type of the typed dictionary's keys as a [enum Variant.Type] constant. If the keys are not typed, returns [constant TYPE_NIL]. See also [method is_typed_key].

method.name: get_typed_key_class_name
method.description: Returns the [b]built-in[/b] class name of the typed dictionary's keys, if the built-in [Variant] type is [constant TYPE_OBJECT]. Otherwise, returns an empty [StringName]. See also [method is_typed_key] and [method Object.get_class].

method.name: get_typed_key_script
method.description: Returns the [Script] instance associated with this typed dictionary's keys, or [code]null[/code] if it does not exist. See also [method is_typed_key].

method.name: get_typed_value_builtin
method.description: Returns the built-in [Variant] type of the typed dictionary's values as a [enum Variant.Type] constant. If the values are not typed, returns [constant TYPE_NIL]. See also [method is_typed_value].

method.name: get_typed_value_class_name
method.description: Returns the [b]built-in[/b] class name of the typed dictionary's values, if the built-in [Variant] type is [constant TYPE_OBJECT]. Otherwise, returns an empty [StringName]. See also [method is_typed_value] and [method Object.get_class].

method.name: get_typed_value_script
method.description: Returns the [Script] instance associated with this typed dictionary's values, or [code]null[/code] if it does not exist. See also [method is_typed_value].

method.name: has
has_all
method.description: Returns [code]true[/code] if the dictionary contains all keys in the given [param keys] array. [codeblock] var data = { "width": 10, "height": 20 } data.has_all(["height", "width"]) # Returns true [/codeblock]

method.name: hash
is_empty
method.description: Returns [code]true[/code] if the dictionary is empty (its size is [code]0[/code]). See also [method size].

method.name: is_read_only
method.description: Returns [code]true[/code] if the dictionary is read-only. See [method make_read_only]. Dictionaries are automatically read-only if declared with [code]const[/code] keyword.

method.name: is_same_typed
method.description: Returns [code]true[/code] if the dictionary is typed the same as [param dictionary].

method.name: is_same_typed_key
method.description: Returns [code]true[/code] if the dictionary's keys are typed the same as [param dictionary]'s keys.

method.name: is_same_typed_value
method.description: Returns [code]true[/code] if the dictionary's values are typed the same as [param dictionary]'s values.

method.name: is_typed
method.description: Returns [code]true[/code] if the dictionary is typed. Typed dictionaries can only store keys/values of their associated type and provide type safety for the [code][][/code] operator. Methods of typed dictionary still return [Variant].

method.name: is_typed_key
method.description: Returns [code]true[/code] if the dictionary's keys are typed.

method.name: is_typed_value
method.description: Returns [code]true[/code] if the dictionary's values are typed.

method.name: keys
method.description: Returns the list of keys in the dictionary.

method.name: make_read_only
method.description: Makes the dictionary read-only, i.e. disables modification of the dictionary's contents. Does not apply to nested content, e.g. content of nested dictionaries.

method.name: merge
merged
recursive_equal
method.description: Returns [code]true[/code] if the two dictionaries contain the same keys and values, inner [Dictionary] and [Array] keys and values are compared recursively.

method.name: set
method.description: Sets the value of the element at the given [param key] to the given [param value]. Returns [code]true[/code] if the value is set successfully. Fails and returns [code]false[/code] if the dictionary is read-only, or if [param key] and [param value] don't match the dictionary's types. This is the same as using the [code][][/code] operator ([code]dict[key] = value[/code]).

method.name: size
method.description: Returns the number of entries in the dictionary. Empty dictionaries ([code]{ }[/code]) always return [code]0[/code]. See also [method is_empty].

method.name: sort
method.description: Sorts the dictionary in ascending order, by key. The final order is dependent on the "less than" ([code]<[/code]) comparison between keys. [codeblocks] [gdscript] var numbers = { "c": 2, "a": 0, "b": 1 } numbers.sort() print(numbers) # Prints { "a": 0, "b": 1, "c": 2 } [/gdscript] [/codeblocks] This method ensures that the dictionary's entries are ordered consistently when [method keys] or [method values] are called, or when the dictionary needs to be converted to a string through [method @GlobalScope.str] or [method JSON.stringify].

method.name: sorted
method.description: Returns a sorted copy of this dictionary. See also [method sort]. [b]Note:[/b] This method creates a copy, which may have a noticeable performance cost. To perform in-place sorting instead, use [method sort].

method.name: values
method.description: Returns the list of values in this dictionary.

operator.name: operator !=
operator.description: Returns [code]true[/code] if the two dictionaries do not contain the same keys and values.

operator.name: operator ==
operator.description: Returns [code]true[/code] if the two dictionaries contain the same keys and values. The order of the entries does not matter. [b]Note:[/b] In C#, by convention, this operator compares by [b]reference[/b]. If you need to compare by value, iterate over both dictionaries.

operator.name: operator []
operator.description: Returns the corresponding value for the given [param key] in the dictionary. If the entry does not exist, fails and returns [code]null[/code]. For safe access, use [method get] or [method has].
